column4: hi, i have xmms running but not listed in my Aplications menu
xmms2? that's a daemon now, you need a frontend for it. try audacity if you're looking for a winamp clone
oh I thought that was superseded by audacious
i don't know waht superseded means but .....
ok. what part of xmms do you want?
so the name is more important than the features?
xmms1 is legacy. From that code came Beep Media Player and from Beep came Audacious. If you want it to be called xmms, then download the source from the xmms site and build it yourself.
if you're looking for something that looks and feels like xmms, then again....   AUDACIOUS
i try to have xmms, that is all, if you don't have wishes to help me that is understandable
fair enough. I've used xmms too, and like it, but I don't see the difference except in the name
fair enough, thank you for your cooperation
have you pastebinned the output from your attempt at compiling it?
